intro: Wendlandia basistaminea, commonly known as the silverleaf waterwheel, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy, white to pinkish flowers that resemble water wheels, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a trailing habit, making it suitable for hanging baskets or as a ground cover. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a silvery sheen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
